Of course, I'd be happy to recommend some movies based on your preferences! If you enjoy psychological dramas with a gritty atmosphere, I think you might enjoy "Once Upon a Time in America." This 1984 film directed by Jonathan Demme and starring Danny Aiello, James Russo, and Burt Young tells the story of a former Prohibition-era gangster who returns to his old neighborhood after 35 years, only to confront the ghosts and regrets of his past. It's a powerful and thought-provoking film that explores themes of identity, loyalty, and redemption.

Alternatively, if you're in the mood for something a bit more lighthearted but still with an interesting cast, I recommend "Mars Attacks!" This 1996 comedy directed by Tim Burton and starring Paul Winfield, Rod Steiger, Martin Short, and Tom Jones is a fun take on the classic sci-fi invasion movie. It's full of humor and great performances, with a standout cast that includes Michael J. Fox, Willie Garson, and Lukas Haas. I think you'll find it to be a fun and entertaining watch!
